SEARCH
Package io.github.thatgarlicdude.pacio.file

Interface Loadable

All Known Implementing Classes:
PacDirectory, PacFile, PacObject
public interface Loadable
An interface used for loading file objects to memory by "opening" them from the system's disk, and "closing" them, freeing the memory.

Classes that implement this interface should make use of the open() and close() methods, as they access the system's disk and memory. open() will load contents from the system's disk to memory, and close() will free contents from the system's memory.

The classes that implement the interface are PacObject, PacFile, and PacDirectory. Each of these classes handle the open() and close() methods differently. PacObject keeps them abstract, PacFile will load the file's bytes to memory, and PacDirectory loads the directory's entries to memory.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    close()
    Closes a file object, freeing its contents from memory.
    void
    open()
    Opens a file object from the system's disk, loading its contents to memory.

  • Method Details

    • open

      void open() throws IOException
      Opens a file object from the system's disk, loading its contents to memory.

      This method should only work when a file path is valid, hence why this method throws the IOException. If the file path is invalid, then it'll throw the exception instead.

      Throws:
      IOException - if reading from disk fails.

    • close

      void close()
      Closes a file object, freeing its contents from memory.

      Classes that implement this interface can call this method as many times, even if the file object was already closed and freed from memory.
